definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: For example my aura colour is green/yellow.
sentences.chinese: 例如我的氣場顏色是綠色和黃色。

sentences.english: In such case you should practise more and you will then be able to see the actual aura.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況下你需要更多的練習，才能看到真正的氣場。

sentences.english: Short-hair Rainie, had the aura all around her.
sentences.chinese: 一頭短髮的楊丞琳，看起來頗有氣場。

sentences.english: Many people claim to see the colors or aura surrounding the human body.
sentences.chinese: 很多人聲稱見到人體周圍環繞着色彩和氣場。

definition: to urge on (of horse)/to drive/to steer/to handle/to manage/to master/to dominate
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
